page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Much of the local history is centred around the German Occupation of the island during the second world war though earlier historical attractions can be seen at the churches and other buildings. {MILITARY HISTORY}The Jerbourg peninsula has been a stronghold since the Neolithic era but the area had no other military monuments until the Napoleonic Wars when "Martello" towers were built of granite at each possible landing place on the coast. They are large cylindrical buildings used as defence positions. Few were built along the South coast as invasion was more likely to be on the flatter more accessible coasts.
